description: From New Latin sartorius (“pertaining to a tailor”), from Late Latin sartor (“tailor”), from Latin sarcire (“to patch, mend”).

adjectives.description: sartorial (comparative more sartorial, superlative most sartorial)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) Of or relating to the tailoring of clothing.
Of or relating to the quality of dress.
examples: In his smart suit Jacob was by far the most sartorial of our party.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Of or relating to the sartorius muscle.
